div.p: After an agency receives your FOIA request, you will usually receive a letter
acknowledging the request with an assigned tracking number.
If the agency requires additional information before it can begin to process your request,
The agency will typically search for records in response to your request
and then review them to determine which records,
or parts records, can be released to you.
The agency will redact, or black out,
any information protected from disclosure by one of the FOIA's nine exemptions.
The releasable records will then be sent to you.
You should always feel free to contact the agency if you have any questions about your request.
The agency's FOIA staff is available to explain the FOIA process to you,
to provide information about the status of your request,
and to assist you in understanding how your request is being handled.
